questions.question: What is an industry?

options.text: Economic activity producing goods and services

questions.answer: Economic activity producing goods and services

questions.question: Which industry extracts raw materials from nature?
questions.answer: Primary industry

questions.question: Cotton textile industry is a ____ industry.
questions.answer: Secondary

questions.question: Which factor is most important for location of industries?
questions.answer: All of these

questions.question: Iron and steel industry is known as a ____ industry.
questions.answer: Basic

questions.question: Which industry depends on agricultural raw materials?
questions.answer: Agro-based

questions.question: Which is a large-scale industry?
questions.answer: Iron and steel

questions.question: Which sector provides services like banking and transport?
questions.answer: Tertiary

questions.question: Which industry uses forest produce as raw material?
questions.answer: Paper industry

questions.question: Industrialization leads to ____.
questions.answer: Economic development

questions.question: What is an industry?
questions.answer: Industry is an economic activity concerned with production of goods and services.

questions.question: Name the main types of industries.
questions.answer: Primary, secondary and tertiary industries are the main types.

questions.question: What are agro-based industries?
questions.answer: Industries that use agricultural raw materials are called agro-based industries.

questions.question: Why is iron and steel called a basic industry?
questions.answer: Because it provides raw material to many other industries.

questions.question: What are the factors affecting location of industries?
questions.answer: Raw materials, power, labour, capital, transport and market.
